As mentioned in the comment from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22815#discussion_r697683792:

> Looking only at the argument (which should directly follow the compiler name) looks kind of fragile and will not catch every case where someone links against libc++.

To expand on that, as-is this also wont work when you're using a versioned clang, i.e `clang++-12`, which we often do in
